Appearance: No Reason: Board Related Date of Action: 10/2/2003 Minutes: HARRISON, Lonnie E., M.D. failed to appear in response to an Emergency Order of Suspension and Notice of Hearing. Upon a motion by Dr. J. Zini, seconded by Dr. J.R. Baker, the Board unanimously voted to proceed with the disciplinary hearing. After discussion and upon a motion by Dr. A. Williams, seconded by Mrs. A. Britton, the Board unanimously voted there has been a violation of the Arkansas Medical Practices Act, specifically A.C.A. 17-95-409 (a)( 2 )(e) and 17-95-409 ( 2 )(a)(i). The official Board Order further reflects the following: As a result of the violation, the Board voted to impose the following sanction: the license to practice medicine in the State of Arkansas belonging to Lonnie E. Harrison, M.D. is revoked. Appearance: Yes Reason: Licensure Date of Action: 2/7/2008 Minutes: HARRISON, Lonnie E., M.D. appeared to request that he be allowed to re-apply for an Arkansas medical license. Dr. Harrison was present with his attorney, Bobby McDaniel. After discussion and upon a motion by Dr. J. Beck, seconded by Dr. O. Atiq, the Board voted unanimously to grant Dr. Harrison's request. The Board further voted that Bruce Murphy, M.D. should accompany Dr. Harrison to his next appearance to discuss the fellowship program that Dr. Harrison plans to enter under the instruction of Dr. Murphy. The Board attorney will correspond with attorney, Rick Angel, regarding his representation of Dr. Harrison in his previous disciplinary case. Appearance: Yes Reason: Licensure Date of Action: 4/3/2008 Minutes: HARRISON, Lonnie E., M.D. appeared requesting reinstatement of his Arkansas medical license. After discussion and upon a motion by Dr. B. Cogburn, seconded by Dr. D. Smart, the Board voted not to grant Dr. Harrison's request for licensure. Dr. Dudding and Mr. Harmon recused from this discussion and vote. Appearance: Yes Reason: Licensure Date of Action: 8/7/2008 Page 4 of 5 (C-7481) - Lonnie E. Harrison, M.D. Detailed License Verification Minutes: HARRISON, Lonnie E., M.D. appeared requesting a limited license to practice medicine in Arkansas. After discussion a motion was made by Dr. A. Williams, seconded by Dr. D. Smart, to grant Dr. Harrison s request for a limited license. However, the motion failed with five votes in favor and six votes opposed. Dr. Dudding and Mr. Harmon recused from this discussion and vote. Appearance: Yes Reason: Licensure Date of Action: 4/3/2009 Minutes: HARRISON, Lonnie E., M.D., together with his attorney, Byron Southern, appeared before the Arkansas State Medical Board on 3 April 2009 seeking a new hearing on his application to receive a restricted license until his completion of a training program and then to receive an unrestricted license. The Board considered at the meeting the original application and attachments that had been submitted by Dr. Lonnie Harrison to include the proctoring and educational program as submitted by Bruce E. Murphy, M.D. dated 21 January 2008 . The Board, after due deliberation, voted that Lonnie Harrison, M.D. would be issued a one year restricted license, authorizing him to practice medicine only under the training supervision and proctorship of Dr. Bruce Murphy with the requirements that Dr. Murphy would supervise his training according to the letter outline of 21 January 2008 . Further, Dr. Lonnie Harrison and Dr. Bruce Murphy would submit reports and documentation and appear before the Board in six months to show compliance with his training program. At the end of the one-year training program and upon the Board approving Dr. Bruce Murphy s recommendation that Dr. Lonnie Harrison is adequately trained and can practice safely, the Board would issue Dr. Lonnie Harrison an unrestricted medical license. The following Board members voted for the motion: Dr. Patty Pettway, Dr. Jim Citty, Dr. Doug Smart, Dr. John Weiss, and Dr. Harold Betton. Dr. Bob Cogburn and Mrs. Anne Britton voted against the motion. Dr. Joseph Beck was acting as Chairman and therefore did not vote. Dr. William Dudding had recused and was not present in the hearing room. Mr. Roger Harmon had recused and did not participate in the deliberation or voting. Dr. O. Atiq and Dr. Trent Pierce were absent from the meeting when this matter was considered by the Board. Appearance: No Reason: Board Related Date of Action: 8/6/2009 Minutes: Issue #09-131 . HARRISON, Lonnie E., M.D. Upon a motion by Dr. J. Beck, seconded by Dr. J. Hearnsberger, the Board voted to grant Dr. Harrison an unrestricted license to practice with Dr. Bruce Murphy at the Arkansas Heart Hospital until the April 2010 meeting. Dr. Murphy must continue to provide written reports documenting Dr. Harrison s number of procedures and his progress on a regular basis. Dr. Harrison should appear at the October 2009 meeting for an update. Dr. B. Cogburn, Mrs. A. Britton and Dr. H. Betton opposed this decision. Dr. W. Dudding and Mr. R. Harmon recused from this discussion and vote. Appearance: Yes Reason: Update Date of Action: 10/1/2009 Minutes: HARRISON, Lonnie E., M.D. appeared for his update. Upon a motion by Dr. J. Citty, seconded by Dr. J. Weiss, the Board voted Dr. Harrison should continue his one-year proctorship but agreed to change his license category to practice specific The Board also requested he return for another update in six months. There were two votes opposed to this decision. Dr. W. Dudding and Mr. R. Harmon recused from the discussion and vote. Appearance: Yes Reason: Update Date of Action: 4/8/2010 Minutes: HARRISON, Lonnie E., M.D. appeared with his attorney, Byron Southern, for his update. Upon a motion by Dr. O. Atiq, seconded by Dr. J. Beck, the Board voted unanimously to grant Dr. Harrison s request to change his medical license status to unrestricted. Page 5 of 5 (C-7481) - Lonnie E. Harrison, M.D. Detailed License Verification

STREETT, David Julian, M. D. Upon a motion by Dr. B. Cogburn, seconded by Dr. J. Beck, the Board voted unanimously to issue an Order and Notice of Hearing involving this physician. Appearance: Yes Reason: Board Related Date of Action: 2/7/2013 Minutes: STREETT, David Julian, M.D. appeared with his attorney, Kelly McNulty, in response to an Order and Notice of Hearing. Upon a motion by Dr. S. Simon, seconded by Dr. H. Betton, the Board voted that there has been a violation of the Medical Practices Act, § 17-95-409 (a)( 2 )(p), that is, prescribing an excessive amount of controlled substances to patients, not associated with malignancy or terminal illness for more than six months and without keeping proper records to justify the ongoing prescribing of the Schedule medication; engaging in a sexual relationship with a patient concurrent with his physician/patient relationship; prescribing schedule drugs to treat chemical dependency in a patient; and prescribing schedule drugs when he knew or should have known the patient was using said Schedule medication for non-therapeutic purposes. The official Board Order reflects that the physician receive a formal Reprimand. The physician is ordered to reimburse investigative and hearing expenses in the amount of $1,665.00 within one year and he must continue with psychotherapy treatment. There was one vote opposed to this decision. This action is not considered a restriction on Dr. Streett s license to practice medicine in the State of Arkansas. Appearance: No Reason: Board Related Date of Action: 4/4/2013 Minutes: Discussion #13-108 . STREETT, David Julian, M.D. Upon a motion by Dr. S. Simon, seconded by Dr. H. Betton, the Board voted unanimously to issue an Emergency Order of Suspension and Notice of Hearing involving this physician. Appearance: No Reason: Board Related Date of Action: 4/4/2013 Minutes: Discussion #13-109 . STREETT, David Julian, M.D. and CARTAYA, Daniel Isidro, M.D. Upon a motion by Dr. S. Simon, seconded by Dr. B. Cogburn, the Board voted unanimously to issue an Emergency Order of Suspension and Notice of Hearing involving Dr. Streett. In regard to Dr. Cartaya, the Board voted to have the information reviewed by the Pain Management Review Committee and review their report at the June 2013 meeting. Appearance: No Reason: Update Date of Action: 8/1/2013 Minutes: Discussion #13-255 . STREETT, David Julian, M.D. Upon a motion by Dr. S. Simon, seconded by Dr. W. Dudding, the Board voted unanimously to proceed with the physician s previous Emergency Order of Suspension and Show Cause hearing. Appearance: No Reason: Board Related Date of Action: 8/20/2013 Minutes: Emergency Order of Suspension issued. License suspended. Page 2 of 4 (E-1489) - David Julian Streett, M.D. Detailed License Verification Appearance: Yes Reason: Board Related Date of Action: 12/5/2013 Minutes: STREETT, David Julian, M.D. appeared before the Board in response to an Emergency Order of Suspension and Notice of Hearing. Upon a motion by Dr. H. Betton, seconded by Dr. S. Simon, the Board voted unanimously that there has been a violation of the Arkansas Medical Practices Act, that is, ACA 17-95-409 (a)( 2 )(p) and ACA 17-95-704 (e)( 1 ). As a result of the violations, Dr. Streett s license is revoked for five years, with said revocation being stayed so long as he complies with the following conditions: he will remain compliant with the Arkansas Medical Foundation monitoring contract and will reimburse investigative and hearing expenses in the amount of $1,575.91 and pay a fine of $1,000.00 within one year; and he will return for an update at the February 2014 meeting. The suspension of Dr. Streett s license is lifted. Appearance: Yes Reason: Update Date of Action: 2/6/2014 Minutes: STREETT, David Julian, M.D. appeared for his Arkansas Medical Foundation update. Upon a motion by Dr. S. Simon, seconded by Dr. J. Citty, the Board voted to accept Dr. Streett s appearance for information only and requested he return to the June 2014 meeting for his next update. Dr. Streett reported he dropped his lawsuit toward the Board.
